value: <l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">15</l>

<quote xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" source="#" rend="block">
            <l>With that a joyous fellowship issewed</l>
            <l>of Minsterls making goodly merriment</l>
            <l>With wanton Bardes and Rhymers impudent</l>
          </quote>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">That was the voice <add hand="ms" place="above">too</add> that was heard too in the great room.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">For when we see the great 
            <choice>
              <sic>Elizabthan</sic>
              <corr>Elizabethan</corr>
            </choice> house--<rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-wilt">Wilton</rs></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">say, or <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-pens">
            <choice>
              <sic>Penshurt</sic>
              <corr>Penshurst</corr>
            </choice></rs>-- we see the stranded relic that has e</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">
            <choice>
              <sic>merged</sic>
              <corr>emerged</corr>
            </choice> <add hand="ms" place="above">like the ribs of a wreck on the shore</add> from thxmxmxx its surroundings. Could we see it</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">as it is said that the airman sees a village <add hand="typewriter" place="above">field</add> wxmxmxxxx</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">xxx from the air with thexxxx scars of <add hand="typewriter" place="above">old roads,</add> other villages</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">and other houses on it. we should see the great house <add hand="ms" place="above">not alone, but</add></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">connected with the village. 
            <choice>
              <sic>W</sic>
              <corr>We</corr>
            </choice> should see a <del hand="ms">ring</del>, an oasis</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">in the midst of 
            <choice>
              <sic>va c</sic>
              <corr>vast</corr>
            </choice> wild country; the 
            <choice>
              <sic>raod</sic>
              <corr>road</corr>
            </choice> a track only;</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">and the oasis like a fortress holding out 
            <choice>
              <sic>agianst</sic>
              <corr>against</corr>
            </choice> the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">uncultivated land; stored against the everlasting siege of</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">nature. If the enemy were man, there was armour 
            <choice>
              <sic>i</sic>
              <corr>in</corr>
            </choice> the church.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">If frost or winter there was grain in the great barn.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">That is the connection between great house and small,</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">between master and 
            <choice>
              <sic>la ouere</sic>
              <corr>labourer</corr>
            </choice> that is detailed in the <rs type="literary-work" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#lit-past" key="Paston Letters">Paston</rs></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><rs type="literary-work" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#lit-past" key="Paston Letters">letters</rs>, and makes indeed the staple of the 
            <choice>
              <sic>mediaveal</sic>
              <corr>medieval</corr>
            </choice></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">letter writing. But there was also that other connection--</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the common belief. That bond between the great house and the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">small has faded, till it is like one of those perhaps rather</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">greener rides 
            <choice>
              <sic>stillto</sic>
              <corr>still to</corr>
            </choice> be found in England along which,</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">
            <choice>
              <sic>abntiquaries</sic>
              <corr>antiquaries</corr>
            </choice> say the <rs type="literary-work" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#lit-cant" key="Canterbury Tales, The">Pilgrims</rs>rode to <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-cant" key="Canterbury">Canterbury</rs>. So the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">scholars tell us of the roads now faded in the mind.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Long before the 
            <choice>
              <sic>Christains ocame</sic>
              <corr>Christians came</corr>
            </choice> the tree was a God;</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the sun was a God; Earth was God; Death was a God. <add hand="ms" place="inline">the</add></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del hand="ms">and how</del> this 
            <choice>
              <sic>anceint</sic>
              <corr>ancient</corr>
            </choice> worship lies beneath the other; how</l>
